intro: Cynanchum subtilis, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to regions of Asia, including China and Russia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellowish-green with a unique corolla shape. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
